metadata.Title: CVE-2020-6400 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in CORS in Google Chrome prior to 80.0.3987.87 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6400` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: alexmurray> The Debian chromium source package is called chromium-browser in Ubuntu

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.3987.87-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
